title: Wewoka murder suspect arrested in Ardmore
content:
ARDMORE, Okla. -- A murder suspect was caught early Monday morning in Ardmore, after a pursuit lasting several hours.
Wewoka Police said Curtlon Panoske is suspected of killing Seth Johnson, 17, on Sunday in Seminole County.
Officials say he then took off with the victim's car and drove to Ardmore.
A pursuit that lasted several ended in Ardmore near 15th and Washington, when a Lighthorse Police Officer arrested Panoske on Monday morning.
Panoske was booked into the Carter County jail on a complaint of first degree murder, possession of a firearm after former felony conviction, and possession of a stolen vehicle. He will soon be transferred to the Seminole County Jail.
